meanings.definition: Having the head cut off and showing only the face
meanings.sent1: The spooky Halloween mask was caboched, revealing a scary face underneath.
meanings.sent2: The statue's caboched appearance made it look like it was missing its head.
meanings.sent3: At the costume party, his caboched mask made everyone do a double-take.
meanings.sent4: The moon, caboched in the night sky, cast an eerie glow over the landscape.
meanings.sent5: The old painting depicted a caboched figure, adding a mysterious aura to the artwork.

meanings.definition: A heraldic charge representing a head with the neck cut off at the shoulders
meanings.sent1: The family crest featured a caboched head as a symbol of strength and honor.
meanings.sent2: In medieval times, a caboched was often used in heraldry to represent bravery.
meanings.sent3: The knight's shield proudly displayed a caboched, signifying his noble lineage.
meanings.sent4: The flag fluttered in the wind, displaying a caboched as a mark of the kingdom.
meanings.sent5: The tapestry depicted a majestic caboched, symbolizing the unity of the realm.
